name: Coastal human population as a proxy for trend in trash
description:
Coastal population, defined as the total population inland of 25 miles, extracted from Gridded Population of the World (GPW) Population Density Grid Future Estimates.



Data sources:



- Center for International Earth Science Information Network (CIESIN)/Columbia University

- CIESIN & CIAT (Center for International Earth Science Information Network (CIESIN)/Columbia University, & Centro Internacional de Agricultura Tropical (CIAT)) (2005). **Gridded Population of the World, Version 3 (GPWv3): Population Density Grid, Future Estimates**. Palisades, NY. [NASA Socioeconomic Data and Applications Center (SEDAC)](http://sedac.ciesin.columbia.edu/data/set/gpw-v3-population-density-future-estimates)
clip_n_ship_disag_description: global trends were applied equally to all regions.

name: Status of Trash
description: Status of Trash

name: Coastal population inland 25 kilometers
description: Coastal 25 km buffer population, from 2005. Source HYDE

name: Regulation 850/2004/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 29 April 2004 on persistent organic pollutants and amending Directive 79/117/EEC
description: Regulation 850/2004/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 29 April 2004 on persistent organic pollutants and amending Directive 79/117/EEC

name: Trend of PFOS contaminants indicator. HELCOM human health threshold.
description: Trend calculated on basin times series (2005-2015) for each HOLAS basin and applied to all BHI regions

name: Status of PFOS contaminants indicator. HELCOM human health threshold.
description: Status calculated only for most recent period (2010-2014) for each HOLAS basin and applied to all BHI regions

name: Penalty factor for CON
description: Penalty factor for measuring only a percentage of identified toxins

name: Trend of ICES6 con indicator based on the ICES6 pcbs. HELCOM and EU human health threshold used
description: Trend calculated on basin time series (2004-2013) with each observation first transformed to a ?status? based on the human health threshold. Basin trends applied to BHI regions

name: Status of ICES6 con indicator based on the ICES6 pcbs. HELCOM and EU human health threshold used
description: Status calculated only for most recent period (2009-2013) for each HOLAS basin and applied to all BHI regions

name: Trend  of dioxin and dioxin-like PCB indicator.  HELCOM and EU human health threshold used.
description: Trend calculated on basin time series (2004-2013) with each observation first transformed to a ?status? based on the human health threshold. Basin trends applied to BHI regions

name: Status of dioxin and dioxin-like PCB indicator. HELCOM and EU human health threshold used.
description: Status calculated only for most recent period (2009-2013) for each HOLAS basin and applied to all BHI regions

name: Trend of Trash
description: Trend of Trash based on status of 2010 and 2015

name: Trend of EUT
description: Trend of eutrofication subgoal based on DIN, DIP, Chla, Secchi, and anoxia data

name: Status of EUT
description: Status of eutrophication subgoal based on DIN, DIP, Chla, Secchi, and anoxia data

name: Trend of eco
description: Trend of economics based on GDP per capita in the BHI regions compared with country-level GDP per capita

name: Status of eco
description: Status of economics based on revenue from different blue sectors from EU's Blue Growth Report

name: Trend of Livelihood
description: LIV trend calculated in data prep. Based on most recent five years' status scores.

name: Status of Livelihood
description: LIV status calculated in LIV data prep based on ratio of coastal/national employment rate.

name: Number of people employed in each BHI region 25km buffer based on eutS2 employment rates
description:
Employment percentage by eutS2 region from Eurostat.



Data sources:



- [Eurostat database lfst_r_lfe2emprt](http://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database?p_auth=BgwyNWIM&p_p_id=estatsearchportlet_WAR_estatsearchportlet&p_p_lifecycle=1&p_p_state=maximized&p_p_mode=view&_estatsearchportlet_WAR_estatsearchportlet_action=search&text=lfst_r_lfe2emprt)

name: Bottom oxygen level (mg_L_1)
description: From [Carstensen et al. 2014](http://www.pnas.org/content/111/15/5628.abstract). Carstensen provided dbf files containing O2 (mg_L_1) for a series of years for the Baltic Proper and the Gulf of Finland. Other areas are not included in this study but at the present time have no anoxia problems - therefore they will recieve a pressure value of 0.  Data scaled between 0 and 1.

description: Modelled annual deep water (depth differs by basin) salinity using the BALTSEM model, Future projections force by the ECHAM5 global climate model A1b scenario.
